## Citations

````{.markdown filename="my-document.qmd" code-line-numbers=4,7}
---
title: "My Cool Document"
format: html
bibliography: references.bib
---

Computers are neat [@Lovelace:1842].
````

. . .

::: {style="text-align: center"}
↓
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.65em"}
> Computers are neat (Lovelace 1842).
> 
> **References**
> 
> Lovelace, Ada Augusta. 1842. “Sketch of the Analytical Engine Invented by Charles Babbage, by LF Menabrea, Officer of the Military Engineers, with Notes Upon the Memoir by the Translator.” *Taylor’s Scientific Memoirs* 3: 666–731.
:::

## Citations

````{.markdown filename="my-document.qmd" code-line-numbers=5}
---
title: "My Cool Document"
format: html
bibliography: references.bib
csl: apa.csl
---

Computers are neat [@Lovelace:1842].
````

. . .

::: {style="text-align: center"}
↓
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.65em"}
> Computers are neat (Lovelace, 1842).
> 
> **References**
> 
> Lovelace, A. A. (1842). Sketch of the analytical engine invented by Charles Babbage, by LF Menabrea, officer of the military engineers, with notes upon the memoir by the translator. *Taylor’s Scientific Memoirs*, 3, 666–731.
:::

## Citations

````{.markdown filename="my-document.qmd" code-line-numbers=5}
---
title: "My Cool Document"
format: html
bibliography: references.bib
csl: chicago-notes-bibliography.csl
---

Computers are neat [@Lovelace:1842].
````

. . .

::: {style="text-align: center"}
↓
:::

::: {style="font-size: 0.65em"}
> Computers are neat^1^.
> 
> **Footnotes**
> 
> 1. Ada Augusta Lovelace, “Sketch of the Analytical Engine Invented by Charles Babbage, by LF Menabrea, Officer of the Military Engineers, with Notes Upon the Memoir by the Translator,” *Taylor’s Scientific Memoirs* 3 (1842): 666–731.↩︎
:::

## Divs and Spans

For further customization, you can add classes, attributes, and other identifiers to content using divs and spans.

**Divs**

```{.markdown}
::: {.border}
This adds the "border" class to some content. 
:::
```

**Spans**

````{.markdown}
[This is some text]{.class style="color: #cccccc;"}
````

::: footer
Learn more: <https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html#sec-divs-and-spans>
:::

## Divs

**Callout blocks**

```{.markdown filename="my-document.qmd"}
:::{.callout-tip}

Note that there are five types of callouts, including: 
`note`, `tip`, `warning`, `caution`, and `important`.

:::
```

. . .
